meanings.definition: To press or squeeze with force
meanings.sent1: I crush the grapes to make juice.
meanings.sent2: She likes to crush the paper into a ball.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to crush itself into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the books seemed to crush the small table.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler's powerful grip could crush anything in its path.

meanings.definition: A strong feeling of romantic attraction
meanings.sent1: His crush on her was obvious to everyone.
meanings.sent2: Having a crush can make you feel happy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's crush on the cat was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her crush on him was like a bright light in her life.
meanings.sent5: The crush between them was undeniable and sweet.

meanings.definition: A crowd of people pressed closely together
meanings.sent1: The concert had a huge crush of fans near the stage.
meanings.sent2: The crush of people at the festival made it hard to move.
meanings.sent3: The crush at the bus stop was both chaotic and funny.
meanings.sent4: In the crush of the crowd, she lost her hat.
meanings.sent5: The crush of students in the hallway was like a river flowing.

meanings.sent1: The army was able to crush the enemy forces.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to crush her fears and doubts.
meanings.sent3: The team's victory was so great, it seemed to crush their opponents.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed helped him crush all obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The storm's power was enough to crush any resistance in its path.
